item.description:
Hi Group,

This will be our last Friday evening. Our next meeting will be on Monday night which seems to be a better option for the majority of our participants. Please check the schedule for details.


Joe Markley will be here to address change on the state and local level. Here is a little bit about him:

"I served one term as State Senator for the 16th district (Waterbury, Wolcott, Southington) and chaired the legislature's Human Services committee, and the Welfare subcommittee of Appropriations. I also served a term as chairman of the Southington Republican Town Committee. In 1990, I ran Tom Scott's nearly successful 3rd district congressional campaign; the next year, Tom and I organized opposition to the proposed state income tax, culminating in a rally that drew 65,000 people to Hartford. I also ran Tom's independent campaign for governor in 1994. Outside of that, I've been an English teacher and writer on and off."


Thanks again to everyone.

In Patriotism,

Carole
item.name: NCC Bi-Weekly Meetup - Speaker: Joe Markley
